attributes.action: Allow Wellcome to take on the Olympics site
attributes.additional_details: It is outrageous that the government has entered exclusive talks on the future of the Olympics site with Qatari Diar and Delancey and rejected the bid by the charitable Wellcome Trust.   Wellcome's £1bn upfront offer would allow the public investment to be recouped immediately, and the site would become a technology park.   Qatari Diar and Delancey are merely property developers;  their offer would take twenty years or more  to benefit the public.   With a year to go to the Games, it is hard to see much other public benefit from this immense investment.   Let the damage be repaired sooner rather than later.
